issue.title: Add a form to collect labels for type of bug

repository.name: bugzilla-data-collector
repository.description: An extension to help collecting data on Bugzilla

body: We can automatically create some also by using the `crash` keyword, and some keywords for the security bugs (listed in https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security_Severity_Ratings).

issue.title: Multilabel classifier for detecting type of bug

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Initial fix for #20

A few questions regarding this classifier:

1. [class_names](https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/blob/master/bugbug/model.py#L66) would need to be redefined, as it isn't valid for this classifier. (get_labels returns a dict where values are a list, not a string). I think the best option would be to remove it from the `train` method and make it an attribute, initializing it in the constructor. However, I'd need a green light before changing this.

2. Similar to the presence of various tags for security bugs (https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/issues/20#issuecomment-491064287), where can I find other tags that actually refer to the same bug type?

@marco-c

body: Should this can be closed now?
Not yet, as we don't have any labels for many of the types in the first comment.
